channel.title: Lightsaber build project
channel.description:
So I have been getting into VFX lately and started by doing lightsaber blades in AE. I had PVC pipe mounted into a flashlight and my mom said she wanted the flashlight back so I was in need of a new hilt and decided, why not build my own lightsaber? Would look much better then using a flashlight or buying those really expensive replica ones. I did a TON of searching for designs and information and went to the store to buy supplies, took about 3 days to get all supplies with the exception of ordering one piece online. Then it took about one week to construct it and all thats left to do is mount a new PVC pipe in it but the hilt is done so thats for another time. The two LED's light up when you push the button but the camera flash blocks it out. All in all it came out great and will be used in future videos.
[img]http://i110.photobucket.com/albums/n94/archerer98/DCP_1110.jpg[/img]

item.title: Lightsaber build project
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

[quote=“Square, post:24, topic:283455”][quote author=Archer link=topic=374561.msg2825937#msg2825937 date=1244989377]

[quote author=Square link=topic=374561.msg2825703#msg2825703 date=1244963455]

[quote author=Lothy link=topic=374561.msg2824922#msg2824922 date=1244899726]
It’s not the colour, it’s the angle of the button.
[/quote]Agreed, if the button was thinner it would be perfect.
[/quote]That sucks =. Can’t you just model a new button and fit it to it? I mean, you’ve built the whole thing already, can’t you model something as small as the button ;]

Well I can’t make it thinner since the red button part of the switch is hollow on the inside so trying to thin it would break it.
[/quote][/quote]

I can but I don’t want to, it isn’t worth it. There are wires inside the main tube which is sealed at both ends of the saber and the wires are attached to the button, so I would be undoing almost all of this just for the button and that is not worth the trouble.

Read full topic

It’s not the colour, it’s the angle of the button.
[/quote]Agreed, if the button was thinner it would be perfect.

Well I can’t make it thinner since the red button part of the switch is hollow on the inside so trying to thin it would break it.[/quote]That sucks =. Can’t you just model a new button and fit it to it? I mean, you’ve built the whole thing already, can’t you model something as small as the button ;]

item.title: Lightsaber build project
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

Lothy:

Very impressive, but I’m not a fan of the red button either. That aside, it’s brilliant.

Heh, I had a black button of different shape that blended right in with the grip but it was defective and didn’t want to go out and get another when I had this one, but its only my first :P.

sanga282:

i like the way your mum wanted the torch back so you had to take the old one apart lol couldnt you have got a second torch? although my mum woulda done the same

I could but I figured it would look better to make something like a lightsaber.

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:16, topic:283455”]I smell the new Star Wars Kid.

It looks brilliant but I am not keen on the red button; it seems to stick out in an odd fashion.[/quote] Lol, I wont be the new star wars kid but would like to make some fight scene with it sometime.

Read full topic

item.title: Lightsaber build project
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:8, topic:283455”]Holy crap, im into AE also and i have been messing with lightsabers, i started with andrew kramers but i find rotoscoping and blur layers alot better. Ive also composited myself 4 times into one continuous shot, and all 4 clones of me shooting each other. It came out perfect. Id love to post it but im not going to due to the fact that i was experimenting and had my shirt off etc.

u and me is like pees an carrots.

Archer, how do you manage to keep an accurate length throughout the film? Oh i see your attaching a pvc.

btw just buy a cheep plastic retractable ones and snap the blade off.[/quote]
I’ve seen Andrew Kramer’s tutorials, they’re amazing!

Sadly, you need those expensive plug-ins, but at the time I was watching them (1-2 years ago), I couldn’t find a torrent for one.

Any ways, looks nice.

Read full topic

meh, to me it doesnt matter when its moving.
